se.vingmedia.xss.server
Class ClientConnection

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Thread
        |
        +--se.vingmedia.xss.server.ClientConnection
public class ClientConnection
extends java.lang.Thread

A ClientConnection handles the separate thread that reads from a client. Each ClientConnection is associated with exactly one client, and is therefore the primary interface for all client I/O and communication.

Fields inherited from class java.lang.Thread
MAX_PRIORITY, MIN_PRIORITY, NORM_PRIORITY

Method Detail

addConnectionEventListener

public void addConnectionEventListener(ConnectionEventReceiver c)
Adds a ConnectionEventReceiver to the list of listeners which will receive a notification when something happens to this object.

getReceiveBroadcasts

public boolean getReceiveBroadcasts()
Returns the boolean value of the "receiveBroadcasts" property. If this property is set to "false", this client will not receive broadcasts sent with ClientProxy.broadcast(ClientConnection, String).

setReceiveBroadcasts

public void setReceiveBroadcasts(boolean b)
Sets the boolean value of the "receiveBroadcasts" property for this client. If this property is set to "false", this client will not receive broadcasts sent with ClientProxy.broadcast(ClientConnection, String).

putObject

public void putObject(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.Object o)
Similar to getSharedObject()/setSharedObject() in the ClientProxy class, arbitrary object references can be stored in a ClientConnection class, with the difference that the only valid key is a String object.

getObject

public java.lang.Object getObject(java.lang.String key)
Similar to getSharedObject()/setSharedObject() in the ClientProxy class, arbitrary object references can be stored in a ClientConnection class, with the difference that the only valid key is a String object.

setProperty

public void setProperty(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String value)
Along with the object reference storage of getObject()/setObject(), The ClientConnection class provides the methods getProperty() and setProperty() to let a user store String objects with String keys (á la java.util.Properties).

getProxy

public ClientProxy getProxy()
Returns the ClientProxy object to which this ClientConnection is associated.

getProperty

public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key)
Along with the object reference storage of getObject()/setObject(), The ClientConnection class provides the methods getProperty() and setProperty() to let a user store String objects with String keys (á la java.util.Properties).

getId

public int getId()
Returns an integer unique for this server instance representing this ClientConnection.

send

public void send(java.lang.String s)
          throws java.io.IOException
Sends a NULL-terminated bunch of octets to the client. The octets sent are acquired from the String object using String.getBytes(). There is room for improvement here.

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Closes the TCP socket associated with this ClientConnection

getInetAddress

public java.net.InetAddress getInetAddress()
Returns the peer Internet address of this client's socket.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns an identifying string that equals "[CID: " + getId() + "]".
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Thread

run

public void run()
This is the main loop, which reads NULL-terminated (\0) strings and calls the XML parser (which in turn may call a matching XML module).
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

finish

public void finish()
This method simply tells the thread's loop to quit upon next iteration.

getIdleTimeMillis

public long getIdleTimeMillis()
Returns the number of milliseconds elapsed since this client sent any data.
